title: A man bought one cow & one goat at Rs. 2500. He sold cow at 20% profit and goat at 30%. Find the C.P. of goat if selling price of both was same? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Cost price of Goat is Rs. 1200. Explanation: Let cost of Cow be X and coat of goat be Y. X+Y= Rs. 2500. Sale of Cow was at a profit of 20% and Sale of Goat was at a profit of 30%. Given that selling price of both the animals is same.  => X+20%(X) = Y+ 30%(Y) => X = Rs. 1300 and Y = 1200 => The Cost Price of Cow is Rs. 1300 and the Cost price of Goat is Rs. 1200.

You can solve this problem easily by using the concept of ratio and proportion, Let the CP of cow and goat be X and Y respectively. He sold the cow at 20% profit, SP will be 120% of CP = 6x/5,And goat at 30% profit, SP will be 130% of CP = 13y/10 by putting SP equal the ratio of their CP (x:y) will be 13:12. So the cost price of goat will be 1200.
